content.description: This is the right line on the small buttress down and right of the main area. This line shares anchors with the line to the left. It is not the best warm-up, since the climbing is slightly off balance and insecure.
content.location: This is the right line on the small buttress below the main area.

content.description:
Climb the left of two bolted lines on a small buttress down and right of the main area. This line shares anchors with the line to the right.

It is a good warm-up for the area.
content.location: This is the left of the two bolted lines on a small buttress down and right of the main area.

content.description: Balancy slab climbing through the first three bolts leads to a ledge rest before another brief crux in a corner.
content.location:
This is located to the left of

The Green Bastard

and to the right of

Dirty Burger

.

content.description:
This has tech, slopers, and big roof on positive holds - a bit of everything!

Head up easy terrain to the technical crux at the fourth bolt. Then go up slopers to a no hands rest. The pump crux heads out the roof on positive holds to the anchors.
content.location: It is the seventh route from the left. From the left side routes, scramble right to the top of a pile of boulders. The route is straight above heading out over the roof at the top.

content.description: Balance, slopers, and tough stand up moves on big feet make for a challenging route.
content.location: It is the leftmost route on the wall.

content.description:
Starstruck has fun climbing on decent rock.

Scramble up a corner to bolts leading up the left wall of the dihedral. From the ramp at the top of the dihedral, continue up the headwall to the anchors.
content.location: It is the second route from the right, and it climbs the left wall of a large, right-facing dihedral.

content.description: This line climbs a slab to the right of a V-shaped dihedral system to the left. This is probably the most enjoyable warm-up at Sunnyville.
content.location: It is the first visible slab climb on the right side.

content.description: Start up the easy dihedral, and continue up moderate climbing to the crux traverse left at the roof. The anchors are a short distance above.
content.location:
It is the seventh route from the left. Start up a prominent, left-facing dihedral just left of where you scramble to the pile of rocks at the base of

The Swayze Express

.

content.description:
P1. 5.11b. Climb edges and liebacks through bulging terrain to a right-facing dihedral. Continue up to a left-facing dihedral/chimney and the anchors.

It has some very flaky rock that hopefully will clean up with traffic.
content.protection: 9 bolts. Take a couple of long slings.
content.location: This is the second route from the left side of the wall. Start just left of a black, overhanging section of rock.
